data.title: You can't beat this local theater for great entertainment
data.text: Just saw another great performance at this treasure of a theater.  Our local actors did a fantastic job with "A Funny Thing Happened On The Way to The Forum".  Orchestra, sets, actors were all great and you can't beat the $26 price!  Solid laughter, great singing - an incredible evening once again!

data.title: Our home town center for small shows
data.text: Great venue right here in town.  Lots of shows, including some pretty good cover bands and Broadway type productions.  Every seat is a good one, affordably priced tickets.  We go to several events each year, would like to keep it to ourselves, but the secret is out and we have to share.

data.title: Great smaller venue
data.text: This is a place where I and my relatives have seen many performances- one in which my own son has performed in theatre as well.  Its very nice and well kept, attractive and hosts many events as well.  The seating is smaller and more intimate, which is actually better for plays as you have a greater and better vantage point and can see expressions on peoples' faces.  Very reasonable pricing on tickets and some great entertainment here.  Comparable to larger venues except on a smaller scale and snacks and refreshments are also offered.  Its great for the elderly as there is not as much walking involved in getting to their seats as in some of the larger venues.

data.title: Enjoyable Night Out
data.text: the Largo Cultural Center is a very good venue for various types of entertainment, from Rock & Roll, Classical, Gaelic and Christmas shows.  The theater is not that large.  So, every seat is a good one.  The volunteers are very friendly and helpful. This is an inexpensive ticket to see some "named" acts.  Our most recent visit was the fist week of December.  We saw the CELTIC CHRISTMAS show and we enjoyed every minute of it.

data.title: Great venue for entertainment at reasonable prices
data.text: Largo Cultural Center is located off East Bay on the Central Park grounds.  It is a great local asset, offering a variety of entertainment at very reasonable prices.  If you live in the area or are here seasonally, I suggest that you sign up for email alerts to get notified about upcoming performances and events.

data.title: Excellent venue
data.text: I have gone to many musical plays here and found them to be top rate for a small company. All seats are good and the people who work there are knowledgeable and kind.

data.title: Largo Cultural Center
data.text: This is the second time that I had the opportunity to attend a production at the Largo Cultural Center. This time was a "Les Paul & Mary Ford Tribute". and in 2013 "Forbidden Broadway" a parody of Broadway musicals. The Center offers a wide range of entertainment at reasonable prices.  The venue is set up for tiered seating or cabaret style. If you are in the area and looking for something fun to do go to largoarts.com for performances.

data.title: Good Value
data.text: Attended 2 concerts very good. no blocked views  all seats are great.  Good parking lot well lit. Seats about 300 people. Lots volunteers to find your seat  Wheelchair assessable

data.title: Saw the Babys in concert
data.text: The show was great, only negative thing is the sound system should have toned down the instruments, it was hard to hear the singer when the guitar played, for both the Babys and the opening act.

data.title: Spring Baseball For Performing Arts Fans
data.text:
I do not know quite how they manage it for the venue has limited seating, and ticket prices are a fraction of other venues. But, I liken it to Spring Baseball for the Arts. The players are big league 
(or used to be or will be), you can sit steps away from them, your can afford to go often, they sell adult beverages, it is located in a parking and you can park steps away. Unlike baseball, the acts are varied: plays, musicals, solo and group musical concerts, even some dance, comedy and children's performances. There are restaurants nearby, to make an evening of it.

data.title: Nice venue!
data.text: We have attended several performances here.  All were excellent and reasonably priced. The sound system is also very good. This is a smaller venue where no seat is more than 50 feet from the stage - cozy!  Some shows had seats and the other was cabaret seating..  The restrooms are clean & there is plenty of free parking.

data.title: AN INTIMATE REASONABLE VENUE
data.text:
This is where I live, not a huge city, about 80,000 full time residents but Largo is growing not in size but in the diversification of the arts and culture.  In the past few years we expanded both trails, sports centers, and we have several parks, beautiful botanical gardens,  a super relatively new Library with all the up to date features for tablets and a cultural center that brings the best shows and entertainment to the area.

Staffed with volunteers, you always feel welcome in this small theatre, but its rewarded by good acoustics and a good view from any seat in the house.  I would rather go here and see a show than in the bigger venues.

Parking is easy, no steps no escalators, you park and walk in.

It is an affordable venue, not as outrageous as some venues and they feature lots of locally grown talent.   
Refreshments are available and in some of the shows we got to meet the actors after. Nice touch.

data.title: Very enjoyable evening!
data.text: My husband and I attended a concert here last week to benefit Toys For Tots.  The featured groups were Tommy Mara and the Crests and The Drifters.  Great concert and both groups had the house rocking.  Comfortable seating and the performers walked through the audience and shook hands.   Theater is clean and staff is very accommodating and welcoming.  We will return often.

data.title: Great place for a concert
data.text: Excellent acoustics, small, intimate setting, enjoyable environment.  The Largo Cultural Center is our favorite venue for a concert or show.

data.title: The City Believes in Publically Supporting the Arts
data.text: intimate venue to immerse oneself in musical composition or or a play. Ample parking. lots of changing entertaining shows.

data.title: Great venue for live theater and shows
data.text: Largo and Pinellas County is very fortunate to have such a fine theater (Eight O'clock Theatre) to provide quality shows and other live events and concerts.  The staff/volunteers are very helpful, seating is very good and productions have been great most of the time.  Very affordable prices, intimate seating and can book your own seats or call/stop by their office to purchase easily.  Have never been disappointed here.

data.title: Fantastic shows at an exceptional value
data.text: First-rate shows from Broadway, kids shows, to rock concerts...there's something for everyone!   There is not a bad seat in the house and has a great bar.

data.title: very surprised
data.text: i was so surprised at the list of great plays and up comming events it is so nice that Largo has culture and it was easy on the wallet

data.title: Very nice with friendly staff
data.text: No complaints from me.  The parking was easy, and the staff was very friendly.  The seating and sound system was good.  We would go back for another performance.

data.title: Small and Intimate Venue
data.text: I have seen a couple of concerts here.  The stage is close and the venue is larger than expected.  The staff has always been friendly, and the tickets are reasonably priced.  It is always clean, and they serve a decent variety of beverages.  I would suggest bring cash though, because sometimes only one station has a CC reader.  For such a small venue, it never feels packed even when sold out.
